1067224954255613952.text: (4/4) No matter what causes a fire to start, a properly managed forest is far more resilient than dense, overgrown woodlands. It’s common sense, and it’s time to take decisive action to help save wildlife, property, and human lives.

1067224952707915776.text: (3/4) Today, we witnessed two images that tell starkly contrasting stories – one that resembles a burnt out wasteland and one of a minimally damaged, healthy forest. It’s no coincidence – it’s the difference between land that is responsibly thinned, and land that is not.
